title.narrative: Accelerating youth employment in food and hospitality sector

description.narrative:
1. Young People : These are young men and women with interest to join the job market in the Hospitality and food sector but lack the opportunity for training and skills acquisition.
2. Smallholder farmers and cooperatives: Small holder farmers and farmer cooperatives producing and trading in nutritious vegetables in the peri-urban areas with limited access to urban markets for and combat urban malnutrition. T

Kenya, Rwanda, and Uganda have different levels of hospitality and tourism sectors. Whereas in Kenya it is generally more developed than in Rwanda and Uganda. But in all three countries, there is a perceived gap between the theoretical training offered in the educational system and the practical skills needed in the sector. All countries experience high youth underemployment and unemployment rates. By translating the Manq’a approach to the East African context we want to increase the employability of youth and youth entrepreneurship in the food and hospitality sector. We do this by closing the skills gap and creating strong linkages with the private sector.

Overall objective:
Translate the Manq’a project approach from the Latin American (Bolivia) to the East African context, and develop a proposition in Rwanda, Uganda, and Kenya for implementation.
Long term objectives: Comprehensive Programme proposition on Youth Employment, Nutrition security and Health in Eastern Africa Region
Short term objectives: To validate and Adapt the Manqa project approach in East Africa by December 2021
